revised_title: Infrared Astronomy: Emission Spectrum of Night Airglow
tldr: The authors measured the infrared spectrum of the night airglow from 2 to 4 micrometers using a two-beam interferometer carried to high altitude by a balloon. The most prominent feature of the spectrum is the OH bands sequence. A strong feature at 3.3 micrometers is likely due to methane emission, and further analysis of the interferograms will provide more information on the airglow's composition.
